links.title: Pennsylvania's GOP Senate primary draws backing from some of Wall Street's biggest billionaires, making it one of the most expensive midterm races
links.description: Wall Street executives are pouring millions of dollars into the Republican primary race for Pennsylvania's open U.S. Senate seat - where veteran physician Dr. Mehmet Oz and former Bridgewater CEO Dave McCormick lead in the polls - making the primary one of the most expensive in the 2022 midterm elections.

body:
$AAPL 

It’s algo that got drunk .. stumble like it’s struggling to get up but it will eventually get back up soon!

People at the stock indexes are playing like there is a war between buyer and seller.

It’s buyer fighting to keep stock cheap but it’s seller fighting to make stock expensive.

Algo is playing the game siding with buyer to buy cheap shares.

But .. at the end, it will let the seller to sell higher.

So be patient .. we have lots of crazy folks trying to suppress the price .. on all technology sectors ..

$MSFT $AAPL key to markets next week

They are coming to the rescue!
$AAPL $QQQ WHEELS ABOUT TO FALL OFF FOR APPLE….the. $317 on Q’s coming

Digitimes: Delivery lead times for semiconductor equipment have extended to more than 18 months from 6 months in the middle of 2021. 
 
Susquehanna: Delivery lead times for semiconductors increased by 3 days to 26.2 weeks last month. Delivery times for microcontrollers reached a high of 35.7 weeks. Lead times also increased by a week and a half for power-management components. 
 
$NXPI lead times extend to 52 weeks with the following series in short supply: FS, MK, SPC. NXP’s automotive product prices expected to increase by 30% in June 2022. 
 
$TXN expected to increase prices from April onward. Prices will rise by 20-30% across various products, including MOSFETs and diodes. TMS-xxx series is expected to increase in price in 3Q22. TI is shifting production capacity from lower-valued products (diodes/MOSFETs) to higher valued items (TPSxxx). Plans to transfer 2 of its product lines to support $AAPL 14 production. It is expected to allocate up to 15% of TI’s production capacity.

$AAPL $SHOP $NFLX
